Row.Text: Turns will end automatically when timer finishes.[NEWLINE]0 = Game dynamically scales the turn time.
Game will end when max turns is reached.
No animations are played when units move.
Ukendt antal af spillere [NEWLINE][NEWLINE](Vælg kortstørrelse for at ændre spillerantal)
Toggles whether the game has Raging Barbarians.
No combat animations are played when units attack.
Allows the AI to use nuclear weapons before the human player has.
Civilization 5 does not save or transmit your email (SMTP) password for security reasons. Please re-enter your email password.
[COLOR_YELLOW]Click on this to have the city conduct a ranged attack.[ENDCOLOR]
City is a [ICON_PUPPET] Puppet! You may not make decisions for it while it remains in this state.
{1_CityName} has stopped growing and will remain at size {2_Num}.
[COLOR_YELLOW]Click here to enter the city screen.[ENDCOLOR]
City has a [ICON_CONNECTED] Trade Route with the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital!
{1_CityName} vil fabrikere {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {2_BldgName}} om mere end 99 ture.
City is [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied! It will produce extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness until a Courthouse is built.
City is in [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance for {1_Num} turn(s)! While in Resistance, a City cannot do anything useful.
City is [ICON_BLOCKADED] Blockaded by an enemy unit!
{1_CityName} will grow from size [COLOR_YELLOW]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR] to size [COLOR_YELLOW]{3_Num}[ENDCOLOR] in [COLOR_GREEN]{4_NumTurns}[ENDCOLOR] {4_NumTurns: plural 1?turn; other?turns;}.
City will be [ICON_RAZING] Razed to the ground in {1_Num} turn(s)!
Click here to have this city emphasize production of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Click here to have governor reassign the workforce.
Buy this plot of land for {1_Num}[ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Click here to have this city emphasize production of [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Spend [ICON_GOLD] Gold to fund your citizens' settlement of a tile adjacent to your borders.
This City is in "We Love the King Day", which increases [ICON_FOOD] growth!
Click here to have the city attempt to stay the same population.
Click here to have this city emphasize production of [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People.
This tile is being worked by another city in your nation. You may click here to work it, but the other city will no longer be working it.
Click here to have this city emphasize production of [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Your governor has selected this tile to work. You may click here to override this.
Change what this City's current construction project is. Only one item at a time may be produced.
Move up in the production queue.
You need {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold to buy this land.
Click here to have this city emphasize production of [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Click here to remove all user locked tiles.
In {1_Num} turns your City will grow and an additional citizen will be able to collect resources from a tile near your City.
The City Center is automatically worked for free. Click here to have governor reassign the workforce.
This tile is not currently being worked. You may click here to work it, but doing so may override what the AI has already chosen for you.
You have selected this tile to work.
When you have enough [ICON_GOLD] Gold, this will purchase one of the highlighted tiles.
Connecting this Resource to your trade network will cause this City to go into "We Love the King Day", which increases [ICON_FOOD] growth!
When you have enough [ICON_GOLD] Gold, buy a unit or building immediately.
Toggle between manual and AI control of Building Specialists.
Cannot raze a city that was once a capital
Click here to have this city emphasize production of [ICON_FOOD] Food.
This tile is being blockaded by an enemy. You may not work it until the blockading enemy is removed.
This tile has an enemy on it. You may not work it until the enemy unit is removed.
Move down in the production queue.
{1_Turns:number} {1_Turns: plural 1?Turn; other?Turns;} until a New Citizen is Born
Choose what this City's current construction project is. Only one item at a time may be produced.
When you have enough [ICON_GOLD]Gold to do so, this will fund your citizens' settlement of one of the tiles highlighted in white.
Add an additional item to the end of the production queue (up to six items). Only one item at a time will be produced.
Click here to have this city use the default citizen allocation.
In the previous election, the number of votes received from other Civilizations.
In the last UN election, {@1_CivName} received votes from the Civilizations that had the best relations with them:
Are you sure you wish to kick {1_player} from the game?
A very large world, similar to Earth, where all civilizations start on the continent akin to Asia-Europe-Africa.
Resources will be placed in irrational locations and there will be crazy amounts of some types.
Bridges connecting subcontinents will be 4 plots wide.
A fertile region bisected through the middle by a barren desert. Suitable for duel or two-teams multiplayer.
Small patches of mixed terrain sprinkled across a vast plain.
A map template will be chosen that includes exactly two major continents.
A highly random map that will often form thin, snaky continents.
Fractal-style mountain ranges: medium, snaky and highly random.
A world without oceans, only lesser bodies of water.
A map template will be chosen that includes exactly four major continents.
Fractal-style mountain ranges: small, numerous and well scattered.
Add extra land between civilizations. (Only available up to a maximum of ten civilizations.)
Rugged highlands sprinkled with grassland valleys.
A region split horizontally by desert.
A world where one half mirrors or reflects the other. Designed chiefly for multiplayer fun.
A very large world, dominated by hills and mountain ranges.
All players start on one large landmass. There may be small islands off of the main continent.
A world with regions of big continents and small islands.
The world will consist of a few medium landmasses and some smaller islands.
Fewer, less intensive irregularities in the shape of the coast.
Most bodies of water will be salt water seas of modest dimension, highly randomized in shape.
A region similar to the Sahara Desert of Africa, but with random elements.
An all-land region featuring a large crater lake in the middle.
A region similar to the Amazon Jungle of South America, but with random elements.
A world almost completely covered in jungle.
A lush forest sprinkled with grasslands.
A region similar to the Polynesian Islands of the Pacific Ocean, but with random elements.
A map template will be chosen that supplies one continent per team (maximum of six, however).
Larger lakes and some tiny oceans will appear.
A map that spans the entire planet.
Some hills and forest sprinkled across a vast grassland.
This map is sectioned into 4 equal sections, separated by water, with land in the very middle.
Meandering rivers flow away from the central mountain range.
Each civilization gets its own subcontinent. Both Hub and Ring style land bridges connect the areas.
Bridges connecting subcontinents will be 2 plots wide.
An oval-shaped pangaea with random bays carving in to the sides.
A small world without oceans. Climates and resource appearance defy the laws of weather physics.
Peninsulas and bays are possible. This is the most randomized land shape.
A world almost completely covered in forest.
A circular pangaea. You can choose what type of terrain is in the center.
A map template will be chosen that includes exactly six major continents.
A vast desert sprinkled with hills! Water setting matters greatly.
Choose whether to add smaller landmasses in between the regions created for each civilization.
Extra small, land-heavy region, tailored especially for fast-paced multiplayer team games.
Bridges connecting subcontinents will be 3 plots wide.
A world with regions of big continents and small islands.
Each civilization's landmass will be a solid blob.
A region split vertically down the middle by a wide channel of water.
A severely glaciated world where only regions near the equator are habitable.
Less random than Continents, but you can control the number of continents.
Tectonic-style mountain ranges, along random fault lines.
Each civilization gets its own subcontinent. All are connected in clockwise fashion to adjacent neighbors.
The world will consist of a few large landmasses and some smaller islands.
A region similar to the Mediterranean Ocean, but with random elements.
Large lakes or seas, with some rivers as well.
A novelty map type played out on a maze made of land and sea lanes.
A region similar to the South Pacific area, including Australia, southeast Asia and numerous islands.
A very large world, tilted on its side with its south pole always locked in to facing the sun.
A frigid landscape with only small pockets of more fertile plains.
A world with two large, fairly balanced continents. Suitable for duel or two-teams multiplayer.
Numerous small and tiny lakes, well scattered across the map.
A large region dominated by hills and mountain ranges.
Fractal-style mountain ranges: large, fat clusters, but fewer of them.
A world with numerous large islands, roughly equal in size but varying in terrain. Civs are placed on the best available islands.
An overgrown jungle sprinkled with hills and forest.
Resources will be placed in irrational locations, such as Bananas in the snow.
Each civilization gets its own subcontinent. All are connected to the arctic region at the center of the map.
A region similar to Siberia in northern Asia, but with random elements.
Choose not to add any extra land between civilizations.
This world will consist of many islands.
A map template will be chosen that includes exactly five major continents.
A region similar to the Rocky Mountains of North America, but with random elements.
A map template will be chosen that includes exactly three major continents.
Resources will obey the standard rules in the usual, logical manner.
A standard climate, as if the map represents a whole world.
A large region that is all tundra and well forested.
This world will consist of many tiny islands.
A region similar to the Great Plains of North America, but with random elements.
A balanced map designed for 2 players.
The only sources of fresh water are from oases in desert areas.
An all-land region that has a large salt water sea in the center.
You have not met any city states.
You have not made any deals.
A diplomatic proposal from this civilization that is waiting for your response.
You have not met any other civilizations.
You can not make a diplomatic proposal to this civilization because you have an pending proposal with another civilization.
This civilization has not yet responded to your diplomatic proposal.
You have not had any diplomatic contact.
[NEWLINE]Special unit type may not be built.
[NEWLINE]Settlers may only be built in Cities with at least 2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens.
[NEWLINE]Settlers may only be built in Cities with at least {1_Num} [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens.
[NEWLINE]May not be built while the empire is [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Very Unhappy.
{TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_UPPER_A_AN << {@1_ImprovementName}} cannot be constructed outside of your territory.
{1_TechName:textkey} (Technology) is required to clear the {2_FeatureName:textkey} from this tile.
You own {1_NumUnits} {1_NumUnits: plural 1?unit; other?units;} which {1_NumUnits: plural 1?does not; other?do not;} require maintenance.
Because of your civilization's traits, they produce {1_Num}% the usual amount.
Hver [ICON_CITIZEN] Borger i en (ikke-besat) by producerer 1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Vrede
Because of bonuses your empire has earned, they produce {1_Num}% the usual amount.
Total cost of maintaining Buildings you own.
Total cost of maintaining Roads and Railroads you have built, or are responsible for. Roads cost 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per turn, and RRs cost 2 [ICON_GOLD].
Every [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen in an [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied City produces 1.34 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness
Because of the game's current difficulty level, they produce {1_Num}% less than usual.
Total cost of maintaining Units you own (military and civilian). The cost for each is currently {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD], which increases with the total number and over time ({2_Num} Units Total).
You pay {1_Num}% of the normal cost because of the game's current difficulty level.
This would be the full cost on a higher difficulty level.
Because of your Policies, [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in your Capital produce {1_Num}% the usual amount.
Because of bonuses your empire has earned, Specialist citizens produce half the normal [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness.
Because of the game's current map size, they produce {1_Num}% less than usual.
The world has been convulsed by war. Many great and powerful civilizations have fallen, but you have survived - and emerged victorious! The world will long remember your glorious triumph!
The world has been convulsed by war. Many great and powerful civilizations have fallen, but you have survived - and emerged victorious! The world will long remember your glorious triumph!
You have been defeated. Your civilization has been overwhelmed by its many foes. But your people do not despair, for they know that one day you shall return - and lead them forward to victory!

You have achieved victory through mastery of Science! You have conquered the mysteries of nature and led your people on a voyage to a brave new world! Your triumph will be remembered as long as the stars burn in the night sky!
You have achieved the level of {1_GreatLeader}

Many years have passed since the rise of your great and powerful civilization. Unfortunately, your time has come to an end, but your people do not despair, for they know that one day you shall return - and lead them forward to victory!

You have achieved victory through the awesome power of your Culture. Your civilization's greatness - the magnificence of its monuments and the power of its artists - have astounded the world! Poets will honor you for as long as beauty brings gladness to a weary heart.
You have not yet completed any games.

You have triumphed over your foes through the art of Diplomacy! Your cunning and wisdom have earned you great friends - and divided and sown confusion among your enemies! Forever will you be remembered as the leader who brought peace to a weary world!
Er du klar til at forbedre {1_ReligionName}?
Vælg en Troendes Dogme (bonus til hver troende by).

{1_SpyRank} {2_SpyName} vil forsøge et statskup i {3_CityName}, ved at bringe en gruppe loyale til os til magten. Den førende {4_CivShortDesc} faktion vil blive bortvist og deres indflydelse reduceret.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Denne opgave har en {5_PERCENT}% succesrate.[ENDCOLOR] Hvis succesfuld, bliver du allieret med {6_CityName} og {7_CivShortDesc} vil have deres indflydelse droppet. Hvis du fejler, vil din spion blive dræbt i forsøget og din indflydelse med {8_CityName} vil falde.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Skal {9_SpyRank} {10_SpyName} forsøge et kup i {11_CityName}?
Tilgængelig senere når Religion er forbedret.
Vælg en Grundlæggerdogme (bonus til grundlæggerens civilisation).
Er du sikker på du vil grundlægge {1_ReligionName}?
Spionen vil forsøge at foretage et statskup for at blive allieret med bystaten. Bystaten skal allerede være allieret med en anden civilisation.
Læs et specifikt kort at spille
The following DLC is required by this saved game:
The following Mods are required by this saved game:
Body for things that need to have a body of text under their title
Read the Latest News (Requires Active Internet Connection).
Dette vil lukke Civilization V uden at gemme dit spil. Er du sikker?
Dette vil lukke Civilization V. Er du sikker?
Dette vil tage dig tilbage til hovedmenuen uden at gemme dit spil. Er du sikker?

At gemme et kort vil gemme terrændata fra spillet du spiller nu i et format det kan læsses ind i World Builder Tool. Dette lader dig have en skabelon til når du laver dit eget kort, eller at du kan komme tilbage til dette kort i et fremtidigt spil.
Glædesystemet er slået fra i dette scenarie. Guldaldre vil ikke forekomme. Alle konsekvenser af vrede er også slået fra.
{@1_VotingCivName} voted for {@2_RecipientCivName} in the last election, since they had the best relations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Current mood of {@1_VotingCivName} towards you: {@3_MoodTowardsYou}
Videnskabssystemet er slået fra i dette scenarie. Ingen nye teknologier vil blive opnået.
In the previous election, which Civilization was voted for. (Cannot vote for self.)
Samfundsværdissystemet er slået fra i dette scenarie. Ingen ny værdier vil blive indført, men kultur vil stadig kunne bruges til at udvide bygrænser.
Compare scores with your friends and the world (Requires Active Internet Connection).
There are no scores posted to this leaderboard.[NEWLINE]Be the first player to post a score by completing a singleplayer game!
Leaderboards are not supported by your current mod configuration.
Leaderboards for all currently installed game content, DLC, and mods.
Display leaderboard of your position on the global leaderboard.
You have not posted to this leaderboard.[NEWLINE]Take on the world by completing a singleplayer game!
You and your friends have not posted to this leaderboard.[NEWLINE]Take on your friends by completing a singleplayer game!
Display leaderboard of you and your friends.
Display leaderboard of the top players in the world.
Similar to Pangaea, but with expanded scripting for chains of islands and city state placement.
A harsh world composed primarily of desert with smaller patches of plains and grassland.
Similar to Continents, but with expanded scripting for chains of islands and city state placement.
Allows embarked units to cross oceans.
{2_YieldType:textkey} fra {1_ImprovementName:textkey} forøget med {3_Num} på felter med adgang til ferskvand.
{2_YieldType:textkey} fra {1_ImprovementName:textkey} forøget med {3_Num} på felter UDEN adgang til ferskvand.
Allows land units to embark and cross water tiles. All units which enter friendly territory gain this ability.
[NEWLINE]You do not have enough [ICON_GOLD] Gold to buy this.
[NEWLINE]Cannot purchase while another unit is stationed in this City.
Network port used by SMTP server.
Use TLS encryption for this SMTP server.
SMTP server for sending turn notifications as the host.
Receive an email when it is your turn in a Pitboss game. This notification only works if the host has configured the game for email notifications.
The SMTP password entries don't match.
Receive a Steam game invite when it is your turn in a Pitboss game. This notification only works if the game is played on the internet and you are Steam friends with the game host.
Email address for receiving Pitboss turn notifications.
A player is joining the game. Please wait.
Human Required slots require a human player before the game can start.
You have been kicked from the game by the host.
Play a multplayer game on the internet.
Network connection to host has been lost.
Steam Dedicated Servers hosted by friends on the Internet.
Players take their turns in order.
Ready is unavailable because another player is using a DLC that is not installed on your computer.
Play a multiplayer game where players take alternating turns on this machine.

Select the game type you want to play and the system will match you with players looking for the same game type. To host a game where you can invite friends to you game and not be joined by random players check "Host Private Game."
Invite friends to join your game.
Steam Dedicated Servers on the Internet.
Retrieve the latest game list information.
Steam Dedicated Servers marked as Favorites.
Open slots can be occupied by joining players.
Error joining multiplayer game. Some required DLC/Mods are not installed.
You are the last remaining human player in the game.
Players take turns based on their war status.[NEWLINE]Warring human players take their turns sequentially.[NEWLINE]Non-warring players take their turns simultaneously.
Players take their turns at the same time.
Stop the game list information retrieval.
Closed slots can not be used by players.
Use a password to start the player's turn
Play a multiplayer game on the local network.
You must have at least 2 teams.
Observers view the game without participating as a civilization.
Steam Dedicated Servers on the local LAN.
Players (other than the host) can enter/exit the game whenever they want. Players are sent turn notifications when it is their turn.
Select game options then host a game. This will create a game that players on you LAN will see in the lobby and be able to join.
The game has the maximum number of players.
Steam Dedicated Servers you have recently played on.
, providing {1_Num} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to the nearest City.
How often the game automatically saves the game.
Reset all settings to default values.
Display on-map Yield information when Civilian Units are selected.
Do you want to keep this resolution? (Automatic reset when timer runs out)
The largest number of autosaves kept before the game begins deleting old ones.
Enables auto-turn-cycling when in Multiplayer games.
Display the simple score list in single player games.
Allow shadows to fade out at far zooms. Improves performance at those zoom levels.
Video options may not be changed while in game.
All Policies will be displayed in the Social Policy Screen, regardless of Era and what branches have been unlocked.
Ryk enheder med det samme til deres destination
Display the simple score list in multiplayer games.
Strategic View will use higher texture resolution, allowing you to zoom in more. It is more taxing on your computer hardware.
When zooming OUT, the camera will pull straight back instead of remaining anchored to the cursor.
Enables quick combat resolution in single player games.
Nulstiller rådgiversystemet, så alle råd vil genoptræde.
Condenses many game tooltips to just the raw information, removing explanatory help.
Forces the game to use the smaller version of the interface.
Save Options and return to the Menu.
The game will remain in the loading screen until all of the terrain in the world is generated graphically.
The game picks the interface size it believes fits your screen resolution best.
Do you want to keep these settings?
Mængden af råd du modtager fra dine rådgivere.
Automated workers don't remove features Like Forests, Jungle, or Marshes except when improving a strategic or luxury resource.
You Must Restart For Changes To Take Effect
The GPU will be used to decode compressed textures when appropriate.
Automatisk vælg den næste enhed efter ordre er blevet givet.
Enables auto-turn-cycling when in Single Player games.
Minimize gray tiles seen while scrolling around the map. This can cause stuttering.
Vis kun én enhed i en gruppeGroup
Disables Reward Popups (Technology, Ancient Ruins, etc.).
Enables inertia when dragging the map.
Changing languages will cause the interface to reload. Is this okay?
The unit selection will advance to the next unit as soon as a command is given and will not wait for animations to complete.
Video options will not take effect until you restart the game.
Enables quick unit movement in multiplayer games.
Enables quick unit movement in single player games.
Enables advanced culture borders. It is more taxing on your computer hardware.
Number of seconds before map view Tool Tip level 2 appears.
Number of seconds before the map view Tool Tip appears.
Enables quick combat resolution in multiplayer games.
Disables on-map Recommendations when Settlers or Workers are selected.
Automated workers don't replace existing improvements.
Players are joining the game. Game is paused.
The game will match you with any of the map sizes.
The game will randomly pick one of the map types for you to play (not Earth). You will not be told what was picked.
The game will randomly pick one of the map sizes for you to play. You will not be told what was picked.
Can not open save game.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]File may be corrupted or invalid.
Leader is unavailable because some players do not have the required DLC package '{1_string}'.
The game will match you with any of the map types (not Earth).
The game will randomly pick one of the leaders for you to play.
The City-State of {1_CivName:textkey} wants you to destroy the barbarian encampment in this tile.
You have captured a civilian which used to belong to {1_CivName}. You have the choice of returning it to them, or taking it for yourself as {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {@2_NewUnitName}}.
Toggles between the Strategic View and Normal Game View.
We don't have any tradeable cities.
Quest: connect with road for [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence bonus[NEWLINE]
Choose a leader to speak with...
[NEWLINE]For finding this wonder (after another team) you have gained {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD]
They don't have any tradeable cities.
Do you want to give {1_CivName} your {2_UnitName}?
Returning it will earn you {1_Num} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence!
All civilizations are constantly at war with each other.[NEWLINE]Diplomacy should be the least of your concerns.
My studies show that your people trust your leadership. Keep exploring and meeting other civilizations, for who knows where the future may lead? We may reach the stars one day!
If you return it, they shall be very grateful!
Ask your advisors about the current situation.
Do you want to assign civilians to different tiles?
Congratulations! The discovery of {@1_NWName} has increased [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in the empire.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Output if worked:
[NEWLINE]For finding this wonder first you have gained {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD]
Congratulations! Your citizens have been happy with your rule for so long that the empire enters a Golden Age!

In the previous election, {@1_CivName} received {2_NumVotesFromCivs} votes from Civilizations. This may change in the upcoming election based on international relations. Civilizations will vote for the other Civilization they have the best relations with.
Antallet af stemmer hver spiller er prognostieret i det næste FN-valg. De reelle stemmer vil varierer baseret på begivenheder der finder sted mellem nu og valget.
{@1_CivName} gets 1 vote from building the UN.

{@1_CivName} will get {2_NumVotesFromMinorCivs} votes from City-States, if City-State relations remain the same as they are now. City-States will vote for the Civilization that most recently liberated them, or their current ally if there is no liberator.
+1 HP healed per turn outside of friendly territory.
+20% [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength against Units in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]OPEN[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (NO Hills, Forest or Jungle).
+25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when performing an [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Air Sweep[ENDCOLOR].
Double movement rate [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Through Forest and Jungle[ENDCOLOR].
Cannot Enter Deep Ocean Until Astronomy.
Entering rough terrain consumes all movement.
May heal damage [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Outside of Friendly Territory[ENDCOLOR]. 2 HP healed per turn.
1 extra [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Interception[ENDCOLOR] may be made per turn.
Eliminates combat penalty for attacking from the sea or over a river.
+20% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when fighting in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]ROUGH[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (Hills, Forest or Jungle).
+25% [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength against Units in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]OPEN[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (NO Hills, Forest or Jungle).
Can embark onto [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Water Tiles[ENDCOLOR]. Embarked units destroyed if tile entered by enemy.
Combat Likely To Create Great Generals.
+20% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when fighting in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]OPEN[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (NO Hills, Forest or Jungle).
Unit may [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Attack Multiple Times[ENDCOLOR] per turn.
Can embark onto [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Water Tiles[ENDCOLOR]. Embarked units can defend.
Unit will [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Heal Every Turn[ENDCOLOR], even if it performs an action.
+25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when intercepting enemy aircraft.
+25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when fighting in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]OPEN[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (NO Hills, Forest or Jungle).
+50% Defense. Unit will [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Heal Every Turn[ENDCOLOR], even if it performs an action.
+25% [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength against Units in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]ROUGH[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (Hills, Forest or Jungle).
+25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when performing an [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Air Sweep[ENDCOLOR].
6 tiles in every direction always visible.
+25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when fighting in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]ROUGH[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (Hills, Forest or Jungle).
Reduces damage taken from interception by 50%.
+10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when adjacent to a friendly Unit.
Must Set Up to Ranged Attack
+25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when intercepting enemy aircraft.
+20% [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength against Units in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]OPEN[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (NO Hills, Forest or Jungle).
+20% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when fighting in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]OPEN[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (NO Hills, Forest or Jungle).
+20% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when fighting in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]ROUGH[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (Hills, Forest or Jungle).
+25% [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength against Units in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]ROUGH[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (Hills, Forest or Jungle).
Provides Support Fire to Friendly Units When Fortified.
Combat Bonus against Damaged Enemy Units (33).
+25% [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength against Units in [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]ROUGH[ENDCOLOR] Terrain. (Hills, Forest or Jungle).
Ranged attacks may be performed over obstacles (as long as other friendly units can see the target).
+25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when performing an [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Air Sweep[ENDCOLOR].
Heals All Damage If Kills Non-Barbarian Unit.
All units in adjacent tiles [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Heal 1 Additional HP[ENDCOLOR] per turn.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Heal this Unit[ENDCOLOR] completely. Doing so will [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Consume this Opportunity[ENDCOLOR] to choose a Promotion.
Combat Very Likely To Create Great Generals.
Heals 2 Damage If Kills a Unit
Improves combat effectiveness of nearby Units.
Can embark onto [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Water Tiles[ENDCOLOR]. Embarked units can enter Ocean and have +1 Sight.
Can Air Sweep to clear intercepting Units.

Because [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness has reached 10, the Empire is [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] VERY unhappy! Cities stop growing, Settlers may not be trained, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production is greatly diminished and Units are less effective in combat!
While in a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age, every tile in your empire that produces at least 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold produces 1 extra and cities gain +20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.

If the above link does not work, cut and paste the following into your web browser's address bar:
{1_SteamURL}
Ancient Era Naval Unit used to wrest control of the seas.

Mounted Unit of the Renaissance Era, capable of fighting toe-to-toe with contemporary infantry units. Weak against other Mounted Units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Only the Russians may build it. This Unit has a combat bonus when fighting enemies that have already taken damage.
A fast Ranged Unit highly effective on flat ground, but slowed significantly when entering rough terrain.
Air Unit that rains death from above onto enemy Units and Cities.
Powerful Ancient Era ranged Unit that can strike foes from afar.
Specialized in defeating Knights and other mounted Units.
Founds new Cities to expand your empire.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_FOOD] Growth of the City is stopped while this Unit is being built.
Medieval ranged infantry Unit. Only the English may build it. This Unit has 1 additional range compared to the Crossbowman, which it replaces.
Naval Unit specialized in warding off enemy aircraft. Can also hold 3 Missiles.
Fast Siege Unit of the late-game. Unlike other Siege Units, it does not need to set up prior to firing.
Basic Infantry Unit of the Industrial Era.
Creates Improvements on water resources like [ICON_RES_FISH] Fish. The Work Boat is consumed in the process. It is defenseless, and will be killed if it comes into contact with an enemy.
One of the first gunpowder units of the game. Only the Ottomans may build it. This Unit is stronger on offense and heals when it kills an enemy, unlike the Musketman which it replaces.
Powerful Renaissance Era Siege Unit. Must set up prior to firing.
Mounted Unit designed to be on the attack, and receives a combat penalty when on defense. Good for hunting down enemy Mounted Units.

A fast Ranged Unit on flat ground, but slowed when entering rough terrain. Only the Egyptians may build it. This Unit does not require [ICON_RES_HORSE] Horses to be built, unlike the Chariot Archer which it replaces.

Ancient Era Unit which specializes in defeating Mounted Units. Only the Persians may build it. This Unit has a higher [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength and heals more quickly than the Spearman, which it replaces.
First gunpowder Unit of the game. Fairly cheap and powerful.
Fast, basic Unit of the late-game that requires no special resources to build.
Mounted Unit of the Renaissance Era, capable of fighting toe-to-toe with contemporary infantry units. Weak against other Mounted Units.
Doesn't benefit from any defensive terrain bonuses, but is otherwise stronger than any other military unit in the game.

Air Unit designed to wrest control of the skies and intercept incoming enemy aircraft. Only the Japanese may build it. This Unit has a bonus against other Fighters, unlike the Fighter which it replaces.
Medieval ranged infantry Unit. Only the Chinese may build it. This Unit may fire twice in one turn, unlike the Crossbowman which it replaces.
One of the first gunpowder units of the game. Only the French may build it. This Unit has a higher [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength than the Musketman, which it replaces.
Ancient Era Unit which specializes in defeating Mounted Units. Only the Greeks may build it. This Unit has a higher [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength than the Spearman which it replaces.

One of the Spaceship parts that must be built and sent to the capital to win a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Science Victory[ENDCOLOR]. Unlike other parts, three SS Boosters are needed to complete the spaceship.
Fairly weak early-game military Unit. Only the Aztecs may build it. This Unit fights more effectively in Jungle and heals damage when it kills an enemy Unit, unlike the Warrior which it replaces.
Powerful Renaissance Era naval Unit used to wrest control of the seas.
A fast Ranged Unit highly effective on flat ground. Only the Indians may build it. This Unit has a higher [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat and Ranged Strength than the Chariot Archer, which it replaces.

Siege Unit that does major damage from a distance, but must set up prior to firing. Only the Romans may build it. This Unit has a higher [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength than the Catapult, which it replaces.
Fast and powerful Industrial Era Unit. Receives a penalty when attacking Cities and on defense, but is incredibly effective in open ground.
The Barbarians' most basic early-game military Unit.
Powerful Medieval Mounted Unit, weak to Pikemen. Only the Songhai may build it.

Powerful Medieval Mounted Unit, weak to Pikemen. Only the Siamese may build it. This Unit receives a bonus against other mounted Units and has a higher [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength than the Knight, which it replaces.
Unleash nuclear destruction upon your foes. Does great damage to Cities and damages any Unit caught in the blast radius.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires Manhattan Project and two Uranium resources.
Strong infantry Unit capable of paradropping up to 5 tiles from friendly territory. Paratrooper can also move and pillage after paradropping, but cannot enter combat until the following turn.

Fast and powerful Industrial Era Unit. Receives a penalty when attacking Cities and on defense, but is incredibly effective in open ground.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Only the Germans may build it. This Unit has 1 additional movement compared to the Tank, which it replaces.

Unleash nuclear destruction upon your foes. Does great damage to Cities and damages any Unit caught in the blast radius. May be stationed on Aircraft Carriers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires Manhattan Project and a Uranium resource.
One of the Spaceship parts that must be built and sent to the capital to win a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Science Victory[ENDCOLOR].
Strong, front-line land Unit of the Classical Era.
Excellent at exploring, this Unit is not slowed by rough terrain, but is vulnerable to attack.
Invisible to all Units except Destroyers and other Submarines, or until it attacks or is adjacent to another unit. Can cause major damage to other ships if they get into range without being seen.
Powerful Medieval infantry Unit. Only the Japanese may build it. This Unit fights more effectively and helps produce Great Generals more quickly than the Longswordsman, which it replaces.
A cheap Unit that may be used once to damage enemy Units or Cities.
Will intercept enemy aircraft which try to bomb nearby Units.
Fast Medieval ranged Unit, weak to Pikemen. Only the Arabians may build it. It is a ranged unit, unlike the Knight which it replaces.
More powerful than Frigates, these Units pay for their strength by being slower and unable to enter ocean tiles.
Basic Infantry Unit of the Industrial Era. Only the French may build it. This Unit has a combat bonus outside of friendly territory, unlike the Infantry which it replaces.
Fast and powerful late-game Unit. Receives a penalty when attacking Cities and on defense, but is incredibly effective in open ground.
Fast late game ship making it highly effective at recon. Also used to hunt down and destroy enemy Submarines.

Mounted Unit designed to be on the attack, and receives a combat penalty when on defense. Good for hunting down enemy Mounted Units. May only be built by the Ottomans. This Unit is faster and can see further than the Lancer, which it replaces.
Most powerful direct-combat naval Unit in the game.
Powerful Medieval Siege Unit, good at reducing the defenses of enemy Cities. Must set up prior to firing.
Relatively cheap Unit specialized in fighting Tanks.
One of the first gunpowder units of the game. Only the Americans may build it. This Unit may move through rough ground as though it were flat, unlike the Musketman which it replaces.
Strong, front-line land Unit of the Classical Era. Only the Iroquois may build it. This Unit receives a major bonus when fighting on Forest and Jungle, unlike the Swordsman which it replaces.
Air Unit designed to wrest control of the skies and intercept incoming enemy aircraft.
Specialized in defeating Knights and other mounted Units. Only the Germans may build it. This Unit is much cheaper than the Pikeman, which it replaces.

Air Unit that rains death from above onto enemy Units and Cities. Only the Americans may build it. This Unit has a chance of evading interception, and does additional damage to Cities compared to the Bomber, which it replaces.

Fast and powerful early game Mounted Unit. Weak to Spearmen. Only the Greeks may build it. This Unit is faster, has a higher [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength and helps produce Great Generals more quickly than the Horseman which it replaces.
Ancient Era Unit which specializes in defeating Mounted Units.
Fast and powerful early game Mounted Unit. Weak to Spearmen.
First siege Unit of the game. Does major damage to Units and Cities from a distance, but must set up prior to firing.
Powerful Medieval Mounted Unit, weak to Pikemen.
Powerful Renaissance Era Naval Unit used to wrest control of the seas. Only the English may build it.
Invisible to all Units except Destroyers and other Submarines, or until it attacks or is adjacent to another unit. Can carry 2 Missiles, and is specialized in hunting other Submarines.
Strong, front-line land Unit of the mid-game.
The first Siege Unit in the game capable of firing 3 tiles away. Must set up prior to firing.
A long-range Air Unit that rains death from above onto enemy Units and Cities.
Fast Renaissance exploration Unit with a large sight radius.
Unit specialized in fighting Modern Armor and Tanks. It is capable of hovering over mountains.
Air Unit designed to wrest control of the skies and intercept incoming enemy aircraft.
Strong, front-line land Unit of the Classical Era. Only the Romans may build it. This Unit has a higher [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength than the Swordsman, which it replaces.
Will intercept enemy aircraft which try to bomb nearby Units.
Improves [ICON_FOOD] Food [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_GOLD] Gold by constructing Improvements on map tiles outside of Cities.
The number of tiles this Unit may fly in a turn.
This indicates the combat strength of the Unit. The higher this number the better the Unit will perform in combat.
Your Unit may move {1_Num} more tile(s) this turn.
The number of tiles this Unit may move in a turn.
Cycle to the PREVIOUS Unit which doesn't yet have orders this turn.
Cycle to the NEXT Unit which doesn't yet have orders this turn.
Reveals promotions your Unit may select.
Your Unit may strike within {1_Num} tile(s) or rebase within {2_Num} tiles.
This indicates the ranged attack strength of the Unit. The higher this number the better the Unit will perform in combat.

Will connect the {1_Icon} [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_ResouceName:textkey}[ENDCOLOR] in this tile to the empire's trade network.
The {1_FeatureName:textkey} on this tile will be removed

[ICON_FOOD] Food is what determines how fast your City grows to acquire new [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens. Citizens work the land and collect [ICON_FOOD], [ICON_PRODUCTION] and [ICON_GOLD] for the City. Bigger Cities are nearly always better!
[ICON_CULTURE] Culture helps Cities claim new territory, allowing them to be more productive. It is also spent on [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Social Policies[ENDCOLOR] at the empire-level.
[ICON_RESEARCH] Science is used to advance your civilization technologically, unlocking new Units, Buildings and more.
[ICON_GOLD] Gold is stockpiled in the national treasury, and may be used to expand your territory, purchase items in Cities and as leverage in Diplomacy.
[ICON_PRODUCTION] Production is what determines how fast a City can build Units, Buildings, etc. It is collected from the Terrain, Buildings and more.
